intro: Aspidotis, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to various regions of Africa and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and milky sap. The plants typically have a shrub or tree-like appearance with smooth, often grayish bark. Aspidotis species are known for their ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. They are also valued for their ornamental appeal and have been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
